snippet: Behavior detection officers observe and talk to passengers for signs of trouble. Such officers, some with explosive-sniffing dogs, already routinely survey checkpoint lines.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column observes that Transportation Security Administration is testing new behavior detection program where officers use on-the-spot observations and conversations with passengers to select some for quicker pass through airport checkpoints; notes that if program is successful, it will expand to more airports in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Behavior detection officers observe and talk to passengers for signs of trouble. Such officers, some with explosive-sniffing dogs, already routinely survey checkpoint lines.
